SPEED · QUALITY MATH

Generated in 30 Seconds

Friend needed landing page yesterday. Used Mixo. Typed business name. 30 seconds later: complete site with homepage, about, services, contact. AI-generated content included. Impressed? Yes. Ready to publish? No. Spent 2 hours replacing stock photos, editing copy, adding branding. Total time: 2 hours 30 seconds. AI generation: 30 seconds. Real launch: 2+ hours. Speed advantage is real, but misleading. Fast start doesn't mean fast finish.

Unexpected Findings From Speed Testing

What nobody tells you about AI generation speed

!

Mixo vs Framer: 30 sec vs 4 min, same customization time

Speed test: Mixo generated site in 30 seconds. Framer took 4 minutes. Mixo advantage: 3.5 minutes. Reality: both spent 2 hours customizing. Total time: Mixo 2:00:30, Framer 2:04:00. Speed difference = 2% of total time. Design quality difference = massive. Framer looked professional. Mixo looked like template. Save 4 minutes generation, lose hours fixing design. Speed isn't everything.

!

"I'll be online in an hour": took all day

Friend thought: fast AI builder = launch in 1 hour. Reality: generation (30 sec) + custom domain setup (30 min) + branding customization (1 hour) + SEO optimization (1 hour) + mobile testing (30 min). Total: 3 hours. And that's fast launch. Unoptimized launch: 8+ hours. AI generation = starting point. Launch = finishing point. Different things.

!

Fast generators = limited customization

Trade-off for speed: templates with rigid structures. Mixo, Durable generate fast but customization limited. Move this section? Can't. Change that layout? Won't work. Framer takes longer but everything is editable. Fast builders = template jail. Slower builders = design freedom. Choose your constraint.

!

Published without editing: "This looks AI-generated"

Friend published Mixo site without editing. Same template as 1,000 other sites. Stock images. Generic AI copy. Visitor feedback: "This feels cheap. Can I trust this business?" Week 1: 47 visitors, 3 inquiries. Competitor with Framer custom design: Week 1: 23 visitors, 12 inquiries. Slower generation, better conversion. Fast + generic = invisible. Slower + unique = memorable.

!

Unicorn Platform: 60 seconds but zero options

Unicorn generates site in 60 seconds. True. But: 3 templates total. Can't change layouts. Can't add sections. What AI generates = what you get. Good for testing ideas. Terrible for production. Fast but trapped. If you want control, Unicorn feels like prison.

Quick reality check: AI generation speed is impressive. Mixo in 30 seconds, Durable in 1-2 minutes. But generation ≠ launch. Generation = starting point. Launch = generation + customization + domain + branding + SEO. Total time: 2-4 hours minimum. Speed advantage matters for testing, iteration, and getting unstuck. But don't expect 1-minute launch. That's marketing, not reality.

What actually matters for speed

Generation vs launch: different things entirely

Mixo generates complete site in 30 seconds. True. But launching requires: custom domain connection (30 min), logo and branding (1 hour), content editing (1 hour), mobile testing (30 min), SEO optimization (1 hour). Total: 4 hours minimum. Generation is 2% of total time. Don't choose builder based on 30-second vs 2-minute generation difference. Choose based on customization quality, because you'll spend hours there regardless.

Fast generation for testing, not production

Where speed actually matters: testing ideas. Have 5 business concepts? Generate 5 landing pages in Mixo. 5 x 30 seconds = 2.5 minutes total. Test traffic, see what converts. Pick winner, then rebuild properly in Framer. Fast generation = rapid iteration. That's the real value. Not launching fast. Testing fast.

Template limitations = hidden time cost

Fast builders (Mixo, Durable, Unicorn) use pre-built templates. Fast to generate. Hard to customize. Want to move that section? Can't. Change layout? Won't work. You spend hours working around template constraints. Slower builders (Framer, Squarespace) take longer to generate but everything is editable. Total time often less. Template jail = false economy.

Speed vs quality breakdown

Mixo: fastest, but template-constrained

Under 60 seconds. Complete site with homepage, about, services, contact. Built-in SEO. Impressive speed. But: limited templates, rigid structure, minimal customization. Great for: testing ideas, quick MVPs, temporary sites. Not great for: production sites that need unique design, complex layouts, custom features. Speed comes with constraints.

Durable: fast + business features

1-2 minutes generation. Built-in CRM, AI copywriter, invoice generation. More business-focused than Mixo. Better for: consultants, service businesses, lead-gen sites. Still template-constrained but less so than Mixo. Sweet spot: speed + business utility without template jail.

Framer: slower, but worth it for design quality

3-5 minutes generation. Takes longer because: more templates, more customization options, more powerful editor. But result: professional design that looks custom-built. Every element editable. No template jail. For most users, extra 3 minutes generation = hours saved in customization. Speed vs quality: quality wins long-term.

Things that drove me crazy

Speed isn't everything

60-second site is functional, not amazing. Fast generation means basic templates. You'll still spend 1-2 hours customizing. Speed advantage = starting point, not finished product.

Quality requires time investment

Fast builders prioritize speed over customization. Great templates but limited control. If design quality matters, slower builders (Framer, Squarespace) deliver better results.

Launch vs publish are different

AI generates site in 60 seconds. Publishing requires: custom domain setup (30 min), branding customization (1 hour), SEO optimization (1 hour). Generation = 30 seconds. Launch = 3+ hours.
